page.title: 08THE ABATTOIR IN BROWNHILLS.
page.content: Ogley Hay School pupils visited the abattoir which employs 50 people. They discovered that it had started as a High Street butcher some 55 years ago. They used to kill only their own livestock but now they get animals from all over the country. The man who owns the business enjoys his work which involves supplying pork, lamb and beef to customers all over the West Midlands. The children were pleased to find that they did not kill cows which have had calves, but learned that they slaughtered lambs of about 3-12 months old as well as young pigs. There are changes all the time in this business. Recently they have acquired a new hanging machine for the sides of beef and soon they are to purchase a glass freezer to freeze meat more quickly.
